intro: Hedeoma reverchonii, commonly known as the Reverchon's hedeoma, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are typically purple or blue in color. Hedeoma reverchonii is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in harsh, sun-exposed conditions.
